ok fine what is the difference beteeb deep copy and shallow copy

The main difference between a deep copy and a shallow copy lies in how the copying process is done in programming:

1. Shallow Copy: A shallow copy creates a new object but does not create new copies of nested objects within the original object. Instead, it copies the references to those nested objects. This means that changes made to the nested objects in the copied object will also affect the original object.

2. Deep Copy: A deep copy, on the other hand, creates a completely new object and also creates new copies of all nested objects within the original object. This means that changes made to the nested objects in the copied object will not affect the original object.

In summary, a shallow copy only copies the top-level structure of an object, while a deep copy creates copies of all levels of nested objects within the original object.
ok fine what is the difference beteeb deep copy and shallow copy

The main difference between a deep copy and a shallow copy lies in how they copy objects. 

A shallow copy creates a new object and inserts references to the original object's elements. This means that changes made to the original object can affect the shallow copy, and vice versa. 

On the other hand, a deep copy creates a new object and also makes copies of all the objects referenced within the original object. This ensures that changes made to the original object do not affect the deep copy, and vice versa.

In summary, a shallow copy only duplicates the references to the original object's elements, while a deep copy duplicates the original object and all of the objects it references.
